etymologies: Middle English: from Old French colour (noun), colourer (verb), from Latin color (noun), colorare (verb)

definitions: the property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way the object reflects or emits light

examples.text: the lights flickered and changed color

shortDefinitions: property of affecting eye by reflecting or emitting light

definitions: one, or any mixture, of the constituents into which light can be separated in a spectrum or rainbow, sometimes including (loosely) black and white

examples.text: a rich brown color
a range of bright colors

definitions: the use of all colors, not only black, white, and gray, in photography or television

examples.text: he has shot the whole film in color
color television

shortDefinitions: use of colours in photography or television

definitions: rosiness or redness of the face as an indication of health or of embarrassment, anger, etc.

examples.text: there was some color back in his face
color flooded her skin as she realized what he meant

definitions: a substance used to give something a particular color

examples.text: lip color

definitions: any of the major conventional colors used in coats of arms (gules, vert, sable, azure, purpure), especially as opposed to the metals, furs, and stains.
pigmentation of the skin, especially as an indication of someone's race

examples.text: discrimination on the basis of color

definitions: a group of people considered as being distinguished by skin pigmentation

examples.text: all colors and nationalities

definitions: vividness of visual appearance resulting from the presence of brightly colored things

examples.text: for color, plant groups of winter-flowering pansies

definitions: picturesque or exciting features that lend a particularly interesting quality to something

examples.text: a town full of color and character

definitions: variety of musical tone or expression

examples.text: orchestral color

shortDefinitions: variety of musical tone or expression

definitions: an item or items of a particular color or combination of colors worn to identify an individual or a member of a school, group, or organization

examples.text: it was Devon Loch's first victory in the colors of his royal owner

definitions: the flag of a regiment or ship

examples.text: all over the world countries which had long been administered by others were hoisting their own colors
the Cheshire Regiment celebrated its tercentenary with a tattoo and the presentation of the new colors

definitions: a national flag

examples.text: he was called to the colors during the war

definitions: a shade of meaning

examples.text: many events in her past had taken on a different color

definitions: character or general nature

examples.text: the hospitable color of his family

definitions: a quantized property of quarks which can take three values (designated blue, green, and red) for each flavor.
a particle of gold remaining in a mining pan after most of the mud and gravel have been washed away.
shortDefinitions: particle of gold remaining in mining pan

definitions: change the color of (something) by painting, dyeing, or shading it

examples.text: he colored her hair with a selection of blonde and brown shades

definitions: take on a different color

examples.text: the foliage will not color well if the soil is too rich

definitions: use crayons to fill (a particular shape or outline) with color

examples.text: color the head, eyes, and bill with crayons

definitions: make vivid or picturesque

examples.text: he has colored the dance with gestures from cabaret and vaudeville

definitions: (of a person or their skin) show embarrassment or shame by becoming red; blush

examples.text: everyone stared at him, and he colored slightly

definitions: cause (a person's skin) to change in color

examples.text: rage colored his pale complexion

definitions: (of an emotion) imbue (a person's voice) with a particular tone

examples.text: surprise colored her voice

definitions: influence, especially in a negative way; distort

examples.text: the experiences had colored her whole existence

definitions: misrepresent by distortion or exaggeration

examples.text: witnesses might color evidence to make a story saleable
